info.title: CustomCollection
info.description:
A custom collection is a grouping of products that a merchant can create to make their store easier to browse. The merchant creates a custom collection and then selects the products that will go into it.

{{ '/api/reference/custom-collection.png' | image }}

Collections are typically displayed to customers so that buyers can select to view only the products in the collection. Shopify stores start with a single custom collection called frontpage—the collection of products shown on the front page of the online store.

The Collect resource is used to connect a product to a custom collection.

There are also smart collections, which contain products based on selection conditions rather than because they've been included manually. For more information, see the SmartCollection resource.

paths.description: Retrieves a list of custom collections. Note: As of version 2019-10, this endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. Sending the page parameter will return an error. To learn more, see Make paginated requests to the REST Admin API.
paths.summary: Retrieves a list of custom collections

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Show only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of field names.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: Filter by custom collection handle.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Show only collections specified by a comma-separated list of IDs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: Show custom collections that include a given product.

parameters.name: published_at_max
parameters.description: Show custom collections published before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: published_at_min
parameters.description: Show custom collections published after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: published_status
parameters.description: Show custom collectsion with a given published status.

any.summary: Show custom collections of any published status.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Show custom collections with a given title.

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show custom collections last updated before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show custom collections last updated after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

200.description: Retrieves a list of custom collections

x-examples.name: Retrieve all collections

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/custom_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::CustomCollection.all(
  session: test_session,
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve all custom collections that contain a given product

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/custom_collections.json?product_id=632910392" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::CustomCollection.all(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: "632910392",
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve all collections after the specified ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/custom_collections.json?since_id=841564295" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

  cookies: request.cookies,

ShopifyAPI::CustomCollection.all(
  session: test_session,

x-examples.name: Create an unpublished custom collection

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"custom_collection":{"title":"Macbooks","published":false}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/custom_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

custom_collection = ShopifyAPI::CustomCollection.new(session: test_session)
custom_collection.title = "Macbooks"
custom_collection.published = false
custom_collection.save!

x-examples.name: Create a collection that contains a product by including a collect

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"custom_collection":{"title":"IPods","collects":[{"product_id":921728736}]}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/custom_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

x-examples.name: Create a custom collection with a metafield

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"custom_collection":{"title":"Macbooks","metafields":[{"key":"new","value":"newvalue","type":"single_line_text_field","namespace":"global"}]}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/custom_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

custom_collection = ShopifyAPI::CustomCollection.new(session: test_session)
custom_collection.title = "Macbooks"
custom_collection.metafields = [
  {
    "key" => "new",
    "value" => "newvalue",
    "type" => "single_line_text_field",
    "namespace" => "global"
  }
]
custom_collection.save!

x-examples.name: Create a custom collection with an image, which will be uploaded to Shopify

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"custom_collection":{"title":"Macbooks","image":{"src":"http://example.com/rails_logo.gif","alt":"Rails Logo"}}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/custom_collections.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

custom_collection = ShopifyAPI::CustomCollection.new(session: test_session)
custom_collection.title = "Macbooks"
custom_collection.image = {
  "src" => "http://example.com/rails_logo.gif",
  "alt" => "Rails Logo"
}
custom_collection.save!

paths.description: Retrieves a count of custom collections
paths.summary: Retrieves a count of custom collections

parameters.name: product_id

parameters.name: published_at_max
parameters.description: Count custom collections published before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: published_at_min
parameters.description: Count custom collections published after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: published_status
parameters.description: Count custom collections with a given published status.

any.summary: Count custom collections of any published status.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Count custom collections with given title.

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Count custom collections last updated before date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Count custom collections last updated after date (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

200.description: Retrieves a count of custom collections

x-examples.name: Add a collect to an existing collection by providing a product ID, and update an existing collect by its own ID to change its sort position

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"custom_collection":{"id":841564295,"collects":[{"product_id":921728736,"position":1},{"id":455204334,"position":2}]}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/custom_collections/841564295.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \

properties.description: The description of the custom collection, complete with HTML markup. Many templates display this on their custom collection pages.
properties.name: body_html

properties.description: A human-friendly unique string for the custom collection automatically generated from its title. This is used in shop themes by the Liquid templating language to refer to the custom collection. (limit: 255 characters)
properties.name: handle

properties.description:
Image associated with the custom collection. Valid values are:

  • attachment: An image attached to a custom collection returned as Base64-encoded binary data.
  • src: The source URL that specifies the location of the image.
  • alt: Alternative text that describes the collection image.
  • created_at: The time and date (ISO 8601 format) when the image was added to the collection.
  • width: The width of the image in pixels.
  • height: The height of the image in pixels.
properties.name: image

properties.description: The ID for the custom collection.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Whether the custom collection is published to the Online Store channel.
properties.name: published

properties.description: The time and date (ISO 8601 format) when the collection was made visible. Returns null for a hidden custom collection.
properties.name: published_at

properties.description:
Whether the collection is published to the Point of Sale channel. Valid values:
  • web: The custom collection is published to the Online Store channel but not published to the Point of Sale channel.
  • global: The custom collection is published to both the Online Store channel and the Point of Sale channel.
properties.name: published_scope

properties.description:
The order in which products in the custom collection appear. Valid values:

  • alpha-asc: Alphabetically, in ascending order (A - Z).
  • alpha-desc: Alphabetically, in descending order (Z - A).
  • best-selling: By best-selling products.
  • created: By date created, in ascending order (oldest - newest).
  • created-desc: By date created, in descending order (newest - oldest).
  • manual: Order created by the shop owner.
  • price-asc: By price, in ascending order (lowest - highest).
  • price-desc: By price, in descending order (highest - lowest).
properties.name: sort_order

properties.description: The suffix of the liquid template being used. For example, if the value is custom, then the collection is using the collection.custom.liquid template. If the value is null, then the collection is using the default collection.liquid.
properties.name: template_suffix

properties.description: The name of the custom collection. (limit: 255 characters)
properties.name: title

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the custom collection was last modified.
properties.name: updated_at

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Manage a store's custom collections. A custom collection is one where products are included manually, as opposed to being included automatically because they meet selection conditions.
